intro: Erysimum laxiflorum, commonly known as the laxiflorous wallflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems covered in soft, hairy foliage. The plant produces clusters of bright yellow, four-petaled flowers that bloom in early spring. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its long-lasting blooms and low maintenance requirements.
